results.title: SR. BUSINESS ANALYST
results.description:
More Than Just A Job, We Offer An Opportunity To Grow! Our project team is exploring to recruiting a Business Analyst to build a future in Reiz Tech!
Reiz Tech is Expanding and Hiring Globally! Growth Is In Our DNA and We Will Help You Grow!


ABOUT THE ROLE

 

The Business Analyst works with stakeholders from crucial business and technical units to understand business needs and priorities, help choose the best solution option, and define requirements for solutions that deliver value. This role requires the individuals to act as an intermediary between stakeholder groups and ensure that business requirements are met when building IT solutions.

 

 

 

ABOUT THE CLIENT

 

One of the biggest financial institutions in Lithuania.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Establish strong working relationships with stakeholders, both business and technical (e.g. developers, solution architects, and UX/UI designers).

  • Gather information from stakeholders and other sources to specify and model requirements.

  • Analyze the requirements’ dependencies, and maintain requirements’ traceability to product goals and solution components.

  • Communicate requirements and potential value to developers and stakeholders.

  • Create and maintain the Product Backlog, and support the Product Owner to build a Product Roadmap.

  • Support Quality Assurance Specialists to ensure the overall quality of the solution.

  • Participate in Scrum ceremonies.

  • Agree and develop a minimal level of solution documentation.

 

  • Strong ability to communicate with business and IT representatives at all levels of the organization.

  • Ability to elicit, isolate and interpret business needs.

  • Knowledge of techniques to design requirements and skills to choose appropriate ones.

  • Experience capturing requirements for complex IT solutions within a compliance-oriented environment.

  • Understanding the software development lifecycle, especially Agile software development.

  • Ability to balance priorities among competing needs.

  • Curiosity and willingness to learn.

  • Ability to communicate well in both English and Lithuanian languages.

 

ADVANTAGES

  • Experience working in financial or fintech organizations.

  • Tertiary or vendor-aligned technical qualifications covering general business analysis (e.g. University IT or Business degree, certification, e.g. PMI-PBA, CBAP).

  • Understanding the database concepts.

  • Ability to read and interpret XML and XSD documents.

results.title: Sr. Business Analyst, AEM
results.description:
Location: Anywhere USA

TA Digital is a digital transformation agency with 30-40% growth year-over-year focused on hiring leaders within the digital marketing space to support growth and build a scalable foundation for the future. Our vision is to provide innovative digital solutions and services by continuing to expand our leadership team and hiring superstars who may feel lost or marginalized within their current organizations.

If you feel:

  • there are too many layers between you and decision makers
  • that your current organization will not make the right decision even after you identify problems and recommend viable solutions
  • you are ready for a bigger voice, larger platform or place for a stronger impact

…then you should consider TA Digital because we are ready to talk to you!

Description:

The Sr. Business Analyst (AEM) is a highly motivated individual with strong technical and communication skills who leverages data to create impactful analysis and reporting to help inform strategic initiatives. The ideal candidate will be able to work collaboratively across a diverse team to gather business requirements and conduct process mapping to facilitate the documentation and automation of product and system requirements. This is a dynamic role in a growth organization with direct exposure to corporate strategy and will work closely with Business, UX, Development, QA and Off-Shore resources as a thought partner daily.

Responsibilities:

  • Obtains the big picture of the product and release vision
  • Understand current business processes and define future business processes
  • Work with multiple simultaneous projects by identifying requirements, facilitating change management, impact analysis, supporting execution team
  • Client engagement:
  • Engage stakeholders, facilitate workshops, conduct client interviews to define business goals and elicit business requirements
  • Prioritize requirements collaboratively with business stakeholders, UX and technology disciplines
  • Define and document business requirements, functional requirements and process flows/ modelling
  • Determine documentation needs based on the project requirements and manage the documentation efforts
  • Collaborate with Creative team and ensure that User Experience and Visual Design align with Functional Requirements
  • Provide requirement inputs during technical design sessions, review design deliverables for consistency and as a source of requirements
  • Ensure that project team has clear understanding of functional requirements and business expectations
  • Work with QA teams to develop testing strategy, test plan, identify test cases and participate in UAT
  • Conduct training session for a product or an implementation
  • Create product documentation and training material including user manuals

Requirements

  • Bachelor’s Degree required (Business or Digital Marketing) Master's degree (preferred)
  • Experience working in the digital agency or consulting firm space
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience as Business Analyst, Functional Analyst or Proxy Product Owner
  • An agile BA with a strategic, functional, technical and relationship focused approach
  • Experience working with cross functional teams in transition projects with competitor vendors
  • Ability in working with both onsite and offshore teams in distributed agile
  • Familiar with use of collaborative tools preferably confluence
  • Experience in platforms for Content Management
  • Can work with multiple integration points for a technology stack:
    • WCM/CMS Adobe: AEM required
    • Adobe Analytics, Target, Audience Manager, DAM is a strong plus
    • SFMC (Salesforce Marketing Cloud / Exact Target), SEO is beneficial
  • Understanding of templates, components and authoring requirements in a CMS
  • Advanced understanding of Site SEO requirements, benchmarking and audit in stage and live environments.
  • Great communication and interpersonal skills and stakeholder management
  • Good research, product demo and presentation skills

Benefits

Compensation:

The salary range listed is for informational purposes. TA Digital treats all applicants as individuals taking into consideration but not limited to their professional and academic experience, specialized training, certifications and associated responsibilities as it relates to our specific industry. The salary range listed is just one component of our total compensation package for each unique employee. An estimated base salary of $115K – $150K plus a variable component is anticipated for this role in the US.

Benefits: Global Health, Dental, Vision, AD&D Insurance, Vacation / PTO / Holiday pay plus matching 401K, Tuition & Travel Expense Reimbursement as needed

About us:

TA Digital is the only global boutique agency that delivers the “best of both worlds” to clients seeking to achieve organizational success through digital transformation. Unlike smaller, regional agencies that lack the ability to scale or large organizations that succumb to a quantity-over-quality approach, we offer resource diversity while also providing meticulous attention to the details that enable strategic success.

Over the past 20 years, TA Digital has positioned clients to achieve digital maturity by focusing on data, customer-centricity and exponential return on investment; by melding exceptional user experience and data-driven methodologies with artificial intelligence and machine learning, we enable digital transformations that intelligently build upon the strategies we set into motion. We are known as a global leader that assists marketing and technology executives in understanding the digital ecosystem while identifying cultural and operational gaps within their business - ultimately ushering organizations toward a more mature model and profitable digital landscape.

Recognized in 2013, 2014, 2015, 2019, 2020, 2021 and 2022 Inc. 5000 list as one of the most successful technology companies in the United States, TA Digital is pleased also to share high-level strategic partnerships with world class digital experience platform companies like Adobe, SAP and Salesforce and possess global partnerships with industry leaders such as Sitecore, Episerver, Elastic Path, BigCommerce, AWS, Azure and Coveo.

TA Digital has offices in US, Canada, UK and India. For more information, visit: www.tadigital.com

EOE & OFCCP Compliant regardless of: Minority / Female / Veteran / Disabled / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity / National Origin

Apply Here: https://apply.workable.com/ta-digital/j/5C26038E03/

results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Treasury Prime is the leading Banking as a Service (BaaS) company that connects banks and fintechs through an API so developers can start building in minutes and launch in days. Treasury Prime’s full integration into core banking systems gives developers access to a wide range of banking services, from opening accounts to making payments to issuing cards. Treasury Prime is backed by Deciens Capital, Nyca Partners, QED Investors, SaaStr Fund, Susa Ventures, and Y Combinator.

Treasury Prime is building a bank partnerships team to engage potential chartered bank partners to offer BaaS products through the Treasury Prime platform. Apply for this role if you want to be an early member and help shape the bank team’s growth, direction, and culture. You'll have executive exposure at Treasury Prime, build the processes to nurture inbound and outbound opportunities, learn about new business models from our fintech and bank clients, and how to build a company directly from a team of serial entrepreneurs.

Account Executive - Banks

You will: 

  • Help develop and execute inbound and outbound partner strategies to create and nurture opportunities

  • Manage the complete partnership cycle from lead to close for bank partners

  • Build and own lead generation and targeted acquisition strategy for bank capacity to match fintech pipeline

  • Own a named account list and develop plans for winning and expanding business with bank partners

  • Develop relationships with executive stakeholders at potential banks

  • Lead and contribute to team projects to develop and refine our bank integrations

  • Engage with product and engineering teams to help drive strategy

You may be a good fit for this role if: 

  • Deep understanding of the highly regulated banking industry and the ability to relate it to the complex technical requirements of our fintech partners 

  • Ability to develop and execute partnership plans spanning multiple banks and fintechs

  • Strong presentation skills for both virtual and in-person meetings with various stakeholders

  • Proven ability to interact and articulate complex solutions to all levels of a banking organization - from CEOs and chairpersons of boards to operations and compliance managers

  • Superior verbal and written communication skills

  • Ability to operate in a highly ambiguous and fast-paced environment

  • Strong interest in the intersection of technology and financial services

While these are not hard requirements for the job, the best candidates will meet many of these criteria. 

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

 

Treasury Prime is an inclusive Equal Employment Opportunity employer that considers applicants without regard to gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, ethnicity, disabled or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you require accommodations or assistance to complete the online application process, please get in touch with careers@treasuryprime.com and identify the type of accommodation or assistance you are requesting. Do not include any medical or health information in this email. Our team will respond to your email promptly.

results.description:

By ditching clunky legacy tools and automating soul-crushing manual tasks, IT admins can get back to more exciting, strategic work. Behind our effortlessly modern platform is a group of builders, innovators, and entrepreneurial thinkers breaking the status quo–and having a lot of fun doing it. Our award winning culture, values, and community are shaped by real people doing really extraordinary work. 
 
Ditch your daily commute, say goodbye to the typical nine-to-five, and embrace a new way of working at Automox.
 
OVERVIEW
 
At the heart of our work here at Automox is to raise the world's security confidence. We are seeking a results-driven Account Executive to join our world-class team. You will evangelize our modern security patching cloud platform to prospective customers. This role requires self-motivated individuals and great teammates who are passionate about SaaS and leading the end-to-end sales cycle. Successful candidates will have demonstrated the ability to identify and bring in new business with their outstanding knowledge of the product and the customer base of IT and Security Ops managers.  Technical conversations and demos have become a critical part of our successful process.

  • Self-starter, proactive, motivated, responsible with a passion for customer engagement

results.title: Data Engineer
results.description:
About us

Bankuish is a startup that helps millions of entrepreneurs and freelancers in Latin America access financial services. Our app connects gig workers with personalized loans and offers from the largest banks and institutions in the region. Together, we are helping banks better serve this niche and simultaneously helping gig workers improve their financial security.

The role

The ideal candidate for this role has a solid foundation in creating data pipelines, ETL and analytical data warehouse. She/He will be responsible for our data and data pipeline architecture, as well as optimizing data systems and building them from the ground up.

This role will support Data Scientists and Data Analysts by providing infrastructure and tools that can be used to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems.

What you will do
  • Build and automate data systems, processes, and models to help us scale our ability to evaluate gig workers, and to make financial services more accessible to millions of individuals around the world.
  • Evaluate, design, and implement analytics tools to facilitate data-driven decisions across the company.
  • Contribute to designing and building our data infrastructure. Influence the technical architecture, and help make decisions that shape the foundation of our data products.
  • Build reliable data services and robust ingestion pipelines for both structured and unstructured data sources.
  • Design and ship ETL/ELT pipelines that transform, aggregate, normalize, and master messy data.
  • Develop and automate large scale, high-performance data processing systems (batch and/or streaming).
  • Define data models for optimal storage
Responsibilities
  • Build and optimize ETL.
  • Build dashboards.
  • Develop solutions to process a large volume of data.
  • Ensure data preparation, flow, and integrity.
  • Create data models and business indicators.
Desired Skills
  • Knowledge in SQL.
  • Experience with streaming and batch pipelines.
  • Experience with python programming language.
  • Experience with ETL.
  • Knowledge in DW, dimensional modeling and data integration.
  • Degree in Information Technology desired
What Makes a Great Fit?

We believe that people do their best work when they are aligned with the mission and company goals. We're looking for an experienced professional who is self-motivated, dynamic, and great working closely with small teams. The ideal candidate believes in doing hard things by doing them together. We're looking for someone who is excited to apply their personal superpowers to serve millions of gig workers – someone who is passionate about addressing issues of financial inclusion and democratizing access to financial services.

How we Work

At Bankuish we are fully remote and widely dispersed, working from our own homes and neighborhoods across the world. We still prefer to collaborate and communicate in real-time.

results.title: Customer Success Manager
results.description:
Hurdle is a Chronomics brand inc.

We are looking for someone based in UK 🇬🇧, but the role is remote first 🏠


Engineering is at the heart of what we do at Chronomics and our API first approach drives everything. We are using technology to disrupt science and empower people with their health data.


🧬 Who we are:
At Hurdle, we are building a bio-infrastructure platform to power the use of biomarkers in everyday life. We are on a mission to “make the unseen actionable”.
We reduce the cost, time and complexity of bio-science by automating logistic, sample collection and presentation of results through our seamless API-driven solution.

We power diagnostics for tele-health, create scientific diet plans, transform how people sleep, customize skincare routines, track the biological impact of fitness programs - all so innovators in every industry can add value to their users.

We are a remote-first company with hubs in London 🇬🇧 and New York 🇺🇸, and employees working from various places in the UK 🇬🇧, Ireland 🇮🇪, Spain 🇪🇸, Germany 🇩🇪, Serbia 🇷🇸, the US 🇺🇸 and Canada 🇨🇦.
Founded by scientists from the world’s leading research universities, we have brought together an expert team across science, technology, business and operations.

We’re growing rapidly and sustainably with revenue outpacing all projections (without the need to raise money externally) and we’re trusted by industry leaders like Superdrug, and Tui… though we’re not stopping here.

Our vision is for biology data and insight to be accessible for everyone. We are at the dawn of a ‘bio revolution’ and to make that happen, we’re creating original and innovative products that allow access to biology at the software level.


🧩Where you will make a difference
Although it’s commonly referred to (and we’ve advertised it) as Customer Success, we at Hurdle prefer to call it: Partner Success.
Our Partner Success team is responsible for the entire lifecycle of our clients. We rely on our Partner Success team to ensure clients are given great service with the utmost trust and diligence and ensure that their experience of using our products exceeds their expectations.Partner Success Managers are “Trusted Advisors”; bringing thought leadership to our partners and advocating our products. This is an exciting opportunity that allows you to combine technical knowledge with account / client management. You will join a small team of two and look after our partners, guiding them through their product requirements from scope to launch, building lasting relationships and making the most of opportunities to expand our partners product ranges.
If you appreciate enabling Customers to build the best user experiences and products and are excited to play your part in our story, as we expand our platforms globally, we want to hear from you.

Requirements

✔️As a Partner Success Manager you will:

  • Own relationship with portfolio of assigned partners, work with them to shape bold product adoption paths that maximize value creation and delight
  • Design joint solutions with assigned partners, identifying best ways to embed our products into our partners’ offerings and deliver impactful vertical solutions
  • Deliver partner deployment projects, orchestrating activities across functional teams incl. commercial, operations, product, engineering and science
  • Own and lead ARR retention and expansion with assigned partners
  • Finally, you may also get the opportunity to Identify product and operational improvement opportunities based on learnings from partner deployments, and collaborate with cross-functional colleagues towards implementation

🚀 You will be set up for success if you have:

  • 3-5 years experience in a similar role
  • Experience in running launch initiatives with multiple stakeholders and uniting everyone around a common purpose, plan and deadline.
  • Experience in account management, relationship building and long-term partnership building
  • Experience in owning ARR renewal and commercial expansion
  • High level technical/product understanding around API endpoints, platforms and infrastructure
  • Comfortable with data analytics and data platforms (i.e. Metabase, BI) as a way to analyse issues and make informed decisions.

☄️What would make you amazing (nice to haves):

  • In depth technical product understanding around API, platforms and infrastructure
  • Health tech / Biotech industry knowledge

😊 Ideal behaviours:

  • Great communicator
  • Problem Solving
  • Analytical Thinking
  • Team player
  • Proactive mindset

Benefits

What you can expect from us:

  • 🛬 Unlimited holidays (20 days minimum)
  • 🏃 Fully remote work with freedom to run
  • 💻 A remote-working budget to help you set up your home office
  • 💪🏻 Private health insurance
  • 📝 Pension
  • 📍 Access Global Coworking Space
  • 🥳 Global Meetups
  • 🎓 Annual Learning and Development Budget
  • 📈 Meaningful equity in the company
  • 💰 Competitive salary + Performance and Revenue related bonus

Be your authentic self at work

As we go global, we want our team to reflect the diverse and multicultural world we live in.

So, we choose to talk about Inclusion and Diversity [in that specific order] because we believe Diversity won’t be successful without Inclusion first. We build teams, cultivate leaders and create a company that’s the right fit for every person in it.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Please note, we don't accept applications from recruitment agencies - thank you!

If you’re interested in learning more about what we do and how you could join the team, please submit your application. We appreciate experience comes in different forms and you don't always need to check every box.

results.title: Control Implementation Specialist/Technical Writer
results.description:
Company Description

  • We are a young and vibrant organization with a strong foundation and looking for the next set of leaders to grow the business. 

  • Fully company-paid healthcare for you and your family  

  • Monthly expense of $100 paid towards health and wellness expenses of your choice – gym memberships, yoga classes, massages, etc.   

  • Monthly reimbursement for phone bill up to $100  

  • Unlimited paid annual leave  

  • Work from anywhere as long as quality work is getting done  

  • Flexible hours – take breaks, cater to your personal and family appointments during the day as needed, core hours 9-4

  • We want our employees to be eternal learners – we will pay for reasonable and relevant trainings and certifications 

  • We want you to participate in the company’s growth – healthy bonus and performance-based commissions to be discussed during the hiring process depending on the applicability to the role 



Job Description

Responsibilities (The work at hand)  

  • Creates, edits, and maintains cybersecurity compliance and implementation documentation for current and future applications  

  • Support internal peer review and quality assurance efforts, assemble documentation for audits and ensure that documentation is compliant with governance policies. 

  • Research and evaluate new documentation needed.  

  • Develop documentation plans and timelines with level of effort required 

  • Collaborate with platform analysts, project managers and subject matter experts to collect and interpret their input 

  • Perform interviews and review sessions with security professionals (including CISO level) to understand the details of control implementation or remediation needed 



Qualifications

(Certifications are important, but we care more about your practical experience) 

Must Haves – Required Skills: 

  • 3-5 years’ experience – preferably in a cybersecurity role. 

  • Professional writing experience either Tech writing or reports 

  • Technology/Audit/GRC background 

  • Customer facing experience 

Nice to Haves – Desired Skills:  

  • C&A or RMF experience 

  • NIST 800-53 experience 



Additional Information

Talent & Cultural fit Requirements (The environment we are creating)   

Below are general qualities we look for in our team:  

  • Content/Domain – Consultative Cybersecurity Delivery/implementation experience. Prior experience with implementing Risk Management Frameworks, specifically, NIST 800-53. Ideally, built, set up and run RMFs in enterprise organizations with the goal of meeting Federal and State compliance requirements.   

  • Solid communicators – people who believe not just in doing the work but being able to effectively communicate the value of the work they perform  

  • Highly collaborative team mentality – the project we are recruiting for is fast-paced, multi-faceted, with team members from various organizations working on a collaborative initiative. We need talent who recognize and appreciate the work of their team members, and understand their contributions are part of a larger vision / purpose  

  • Mindset of simplification and getting the job done – the project we are recruiting for is extremely complex. We are looking for people who have a problem-solving mentality and ability to simplify complex situations  

  • Start with Why? – we are looking for people who think about the mission and purpose of the work they are doing  

  • Empathetic with high EQ – of course we want technically-sound people, but we like them a lot more when they have good attitudes. Bring positive energy and bring the team with you.

results.title: (Junior) QA Software Tester
results.description:

At Grip, we’re passionate about bringing professionals together to move markets forward faster. Our leading Platform for Event Organisers enables our clients to create Live, Virtual, and Hybrid event experiences in a single solution. Making it easier for event participants to connect, engage and do business.

 

Grip works with 12 out of 20 of the largest Event Organisers globally and is known for its leading AI-powered matchmaking engine, used to establish millions of valuable connections at thousands of events. As a multi-award-winning global leader in AI-powered tech, we pride ourselves on being real innovators in the event tech space.

 

Grip recently completed a $13M Series A funding round led by Kennet Partners, a well-known London-based VC Fund. The role will involve working closely with colleagues in Engineering and Business teams to test the various software features used in a wide variety of professional events both in-person and online.

🚀 Experience and Skills:

  • Strong verbal and written communications skills with the unique ability to communicate complicated topics clearly to technical and non-technical team members
  • Ability to understand issues quickly, think logically and break down requirements into testable units

Bonus points:

  • Technical first degree or equivalent practical experience in software testing
  • Experience in both: functional and non-functional testing
  • Experience in using test management tools
  • Experience in using tools such as Cypress, Selenium, Qase

 

🚀 Grip Serbia Benefits:

  • Remote working possibilities (also post COVID-19)
  • Private Health Insurance
  • Company Training Sponsorship Programme
  • Enhanced and Inclusive Paid Parental Leave
  • 25 holiday days per annum
  • Opportunity to take lead in shaping an entire industry through AI
  • A world-class team of sales, marketing, operations and engineering
  • Rare opportunity to grow with the company and take the lead in shaping an entire industry’s use of technology
  • Kind, fun and ambitious company culture

results.title: Finance Manager
results.description:
We’re looking for an experienced, hands-on finance manager to help us build and scale Nillion’s finance function, globally. Nillion brings to life fast, permissionless, decentralized computation. We have just closed our strategic fundraise, with an oversubscribed round of $20 million. The technology fundamentally changes how data is stored, processed, and decentralized and opens up a realm of alternative decentralized use cases.

As a Finance Manager at Nillion, you will assist with treasury management, accounting and financial operations while helping us build and scale internal processes and compliance systems. A key aspect of this role is to help build a solid audit-proof financial structure, while keeping it agile and scalable. The role will report to the Director of Finance.

If you’re the kind of person who, maybe, had a calculator watch at some point, if you enjoy being part of a fast-paced, remote, finance team and like being surrounded by inspiring co-workers, then keep reading!

 

Role and Responsibilities:

  • Manage procurement, accounts payable process and treasury
  • Manage the company group tax and compliance activities
  • Prepare the company group accounting and related activities
  • Control employee payroll/wages process
  • Own the intercompany payment and billing process
  • Prepare monthly group reporting and consolidation
  • Support with the company's budget preparation and control
  • Assist with the preparation and monitoring of annual budget and periodic forecasts
  • Support the preparation of the annual and monthly financial planning
  • Support the preparation of the annual Statutory and Direct tax reporting
  • Support the external tax advisors in the preparation of tax files
  • Identify potential financial risks and opportunities and present them in a timely manner
  • Acting as business partner and liaison for Legal, People, and other departments as needed

Requirements

  • Degree in Finance, Accounting, or similar
  • 4+ years of professional experience working in a similar role
  • Excellent interpersonal communication skills; people-first approach
  • Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
  • Ability to work cross-functionally with a globally distributed team
  • Good understanding of all areas of a financial department, including; accounting, treasury, and controlling
  • Demonstrated experience working in Startups or hyper growth organisation
  • Solid understanding of IFRS, US GAAP, and bridging
  • Working knowledge of indirect and direct taxes (EU/US)
  • Experience managing payroll and related accounting
  • Solid understanding of group consolidation reporting, multi-leder, and multi-currency accounting
  • Proven experience in international operations and environments
  • Excel wizard and experienced with different accounting softwares
  • Fluent in English

Nice to haves

  • Professional experience with Audit or Big4
  • Experience or knowledge with blockchain, crypto or Web 3

Benefits

  • Competitive salary and token Compensation; you will be eligible to acquire Nil tokens as part of your bonus
  • Make a big impact as a early contributor to an incredible founding team
  • Work on new problems in an incredible emerging and dynamic field
  • Learn from experts in a mentorship-oriented work culture

  • Medicare Advantage experience at the plan level in a systems operations capacity, interfacing with both the plan and CMS

results.title: UX/UI Lead
results.description:
Spacewell is looking for a hands-on and experienced UX/UI Lead for our local offices in Eindhoven or Wilrijk. You will define, implement and execute our UX/UI strategy. You will do this working closely with product management, development, commercial colleagues and our (potential) customers. Together with our Product Leadership you will act as a change agent in our transformation in becoming a full product driven company with a UX-first approach. You area true motivator and are able to get our teams excited as well! Are we speaking about you? Reach out!

A day on the job

  • 8.45 AM: You arrive at the office and open your mailbox. Right away, you have a Teams call with two of your colleagues from India. During this call you make sure they are up to date with the newest information about the UX/UI strategy.
  • 10.00 AM: Afterwards, you make yourself ready to give a short training to the (junior) UX/UI Designers with tips and tricks.
  • 10.45 AM: Because you are overall responsible for the product's UX, you play an important role in our product discovery processes, you meet up with your colleagues from product management to discuss the latest requirements
  • 11 AM: Time to fill up your cup of coffee!
  • 11.30 AM: You work on a training for our product managers/owners, developers and designers for using different methods, tools and Figma.
  • Noon: Lunch time!
  • 1 PM: You are also responsible to guide our product teams incorporating UX within their way of working.
  • 14.30 PM: You start with working out a new UX/UI strategy to implement.
  • 4 PM: You work on a set of high-fidelity mockups for the user stories assigned to you. Once the framework is clear, you assign the work to one of the team members.

What about the team?

As a UX/UI Lead you get to be a part of a dynamic and warm team of international direct colleagues. They understand the challenges that come with the job, and they are there to cheer you on when needed. Besides that, your colleagues all have a different background and diverse reference frameworks. This allows you to learn a lot on the job, both in terms of hard and soft skills. Depending on your evolution, expectations and what energizes you, a career path can be developed to measure.

Could this be you?

  • You have at least 3 years of experience working as a UX/UI Designer in product organizations.
  • You have university grade education (Bachelor or Master) preferably in Design.
  • You speak English fluently.
  • You are experienced with setting up an UX/UI strategy from scratch, design thinking and tools like validation patterns, Figma etc.
  • Working in an agile environment and using Scrum is not new for you.
  • You want to grow and learn within your expertise field.
  • You can bring your innovative vision to other people and have a sense of ownership.
  • You have the capacity to guide people and merge several products into one new product portfolio.

The challenges we see in this role

  • Spacewell is a company in full transition. At times this results in organized chaos. However, we stand together as a team to make sense of what's going on and to find meaning in each situation.
  • You're willing to learn, as you will carry out a diverse range of tasks for multiple regions. By linking different pieces of information together, you're easily able to get an idea of the bigger picture and to put things into perspective.
  • You're not afraid to speak up in case you have questions. You have a sense of responsibility and ownership, so that you know when to escalate (potential) issues, when to treat information in a confidential way.

How do we make this a win-win?

  • You get to be a part of a quick, innovative, dynamic and warm team of colleagues with different backgrounds and reference frameworks.
  • Your colleagues understand your challenges,  will help you along the way and appreciate your hard work.
  • You really get the chance to make a difference and to grow together with your colleagues. Such as, for example, our own Spacewell Academy and following LinkedIn Trainings.
  • Next to the flexible work hours and remote working possibilities, you will get a salary and fringe benefits in line with your experience.

What would next steps look like?

  1. You reach out to our recruitment team to send in your CV or to ask some further questions.
  2. You will be invited for a digital cup of coffee.
  3. Depending on locations and schedules, you will meet up with your future colleagues at our offices or virtually.
